meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, the clouds began to recondense in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I had to recondense my notes to fit all the important information on one page.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to recondense the rabbit back into the hat, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to recondense into a single clear idea after a moment of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to recondense the paint colors to create the perfect shade for the sunset.
meanings.sent6: Once the steam cooled down, it started to recondense into water droplets on the window.
meanings.sent7: The chef had to recondense the sauce to make it thicker and more flavorful.

meanings.definition: To make more dense or compact.
meanings.sent1: The scientist needed to recondense the gas into a liquid for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: She decided to recondense her luggage to make it easier to carry.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to recondense the foam they had expanded, but it wouldn't shrink back.
meanings.sent4: The crowd seemed to recondense into a smaller group as the event came to an end.
meanings.sent5: The snow began to recondense into ice as the temperature dropped.
meanings.sent6: The artist had to recondense the clay to make it more suitable for sculpting.
meanings.sent7: The chef had to recondense the soup to make it thicker and more flavorful.
